Many projects that focus on community development bring with them very traditional approaches to their models for what a 'healthy economic' is. Umati Bank is not such a project. Our work responds to deeply rooted systemic problems within society's very wiring. Members and participants in Umati's programs are committed to providing a regenerative benefit to their communities from within.

 

Small Business Management

Organic Farming Skills / Diversified Agriculture / Value added products / relocalizing the supply chain

Electronics Repair 

Many items in the modern world have become unmaintained yet, Ras Tronics in Nairobi's Ruai-Nijiru region has a plan for repairable items. 

Plastics Recycling

preciousplastic.com has DIY systems for shredding, heat moulding, and extruding of sorted plastic waste. In Nairobi, Kenya, a Chinese recycling company, PETCO has expanded its purchasing of pelletized plastics and other PET sourced waste materials from its initial Mombasa processing location, to a second location in Nairobi area. Hope is high that there will be less burning and single use plastics being banned and phased out.

entry.summary: Frequently Asked Questions Yes, one can register in Umatibank directly and begin the process of establishing your group be it a CBO, self help group, youth group, womens group, etc. We encourage groups to work toward forming strong bonds of trust, develod a mission statement, and bylaws to help maintain good process. Can mens groups' be registered? yesHow many members can register via Umatibank? Group size is ideally between 10 and 30 per group, but we are willing to make exceptions of you request a different option.What are the benefits after joining?Comunity banking is not a new concept and has been used to pool resources among trusted members of community for many years in many countries. We find that by having regular meetings where members of small groups support one another through the challenges of lifting themselves up into a better economic flow pattern, a culture of savings is created that has the strength to carry members through challenging times. We wish you the best and encourage you to focus on celebrating and recognizing each of the small successes so that the larger goal can be realized in a collaborative, low stress manner.
entry.content:
Frequently Asked Questions

  • How do I start a group in Umati Bank?   855 752 6749
  • New groups can create a free account on umatibank.com, or by contacting a facilitator,  Kiama, Ria and Geog are available to assist you through the process and they are available from the moment you sign up. Claudia Mbina Mwende (Mbindamwende@yahoo.co.ke) and Daniel Murithi (artatheart3839@gmail.com) are available to assist your group should your group require professional support or trainings.
  • How can groups get help collaborating with other stake holders?
  • the Umati Bank provides assistance for groups to draft constitutions, MOU agreements, etc. Defining your group mission and bylaws helps clarify future relationships with NGOs, private investors and government institutions.  Umati is founded on the premise that smart growth makes use of local resources and builds strong relationships in the community while healing old wounds.  Locally resourceful groups are a good match for Umati.   We are a community that embraces a culture of savings and the benefits of mutual support and solidarity.  We encourage your group members to honor one another and work to replace traditional bank loans, even if they are offered at 0%
  • Can a group register without a formal registration certificate?

  • Yes, one can register in Umatibank directly and begin the process of establishing your group be it a CBO, self help group, youth group, womens group, etc. We encourage groups to work toward forming strong bonds of trust, develod a mission statement, and bylaws to help maintain good process. 

  • Can mens groups' be registered?
  •  yes
  • How many members can register via Umatibank?
  •  Group size is ideally between 10 and 30 per group, but we are willing to make exceptions of you request a different option.
  • What are the benefits after joining?
  • Comunity banking is not a new concept and has been used to pool resources among trusted members of community for many years in many countries. We find that by having regular meetings where members of small groups support one another through the challenges of lifting themselves up into a better economic flow pattern, a culture of savings is created that has the strength to carry members through challenging times. We wish you the best and encourage you to focus on celebrating and recognizing each of the small successes so that the larger goal can be realized in a collaborative, low stress manner.
